abstract: A decade of rapid economic growth has supported upward mobility and the expansion of the middle class in the Philippines. While the Philippinesâ€™ record of economic growth has been sound, many East Asian countries have performed better, resulting in higher levels of economic mobility and more rapid middle-class expansion.
alt: A bar graph shows the perceived and actual household income per capita for the extreme poor, moderate poor, economic vulnerable, economically secure, and global middle class. All groups perceive their social status to be nearly the same, while their income deciles increase sharply.
shorttitle: The Middle Class in the Philippines: An Exploration of the Conditions for Upward Mobility
